page.title: 12PLANNING IN SHEEPSCOMBE
page.content: Councillors could not prevent the Planning Committee from allowing the Croft Field houses.Most villagers think that the houses will damage the village. The Parish Councillor said, "The outcome is probably the worst single thing that has ever happened to the village in planning terms. The houses were advertised as executive homesand the developers set out to attract urban customers. This is probably the first time this had been done and will hasten the decline of the balanced rural community".Some people think that if young children come to the houses it may help the school. People want smaller, cheaper houses, built either singly or in small groups. The Planning Officer agreed that homes for the young and elderly,so releasing houses for families, would be right.
